person.note: Heliodous, active in the 3rd century C.E., is the author of Aethiopika/Ethiopian History, a Classical prototype for romance that was the subject of an international vogue in the 16th and 17th centuries. Lope imitated Heliodorus in El peregrino en su patria / The pilgrim of Castile.

Platón or Plato (428 BC-348 BC) in the englsih translation was a classical Greek philosopher and was the founder of the Academy of Athens. Academy of Athens was the first instituion for higher learning in the Western World.

Jesús or Jesus (4 BC-AD 30) in the english translation was a religous leader in the religion of Chrsitianity. All historical scholars say that Jesús did exist historically but the way people believe the role he plays in Christianity is a different thing. He always preached his message orally and had 12 dicsiples to help him.

Cicerón or Cicero (Jan 3 106 BC-Dec 7 43 BC) in the english translation, as a Roman politician as well as a philosopher, orator, laywer and constituionalist. He came from a wealthy municipal family and his considered as one of the greatest orators and prose stylists. He also had a immence influence on the Latin language and made it what it is today.
Marco Tulio was the son of Cicero and was a commander of Pompey's in the battle of Pharsalia.

Aristóteles or Aristole (384 BC-322 BC) in the english traslation was a Greek philosopher and scientist born in the city of Stagira, Chalkidice in classical Greece. His father died whenever he was a child and Proxenus of Atarneus became his legal guardian.
Juan Latino (1518-1596) was a black Spanish professor at the Univeristy of Granada during the 16th century. s
Francesco Petrarca (July 20, 1304-July 20, 1374) was a Italian Poet and scholar during the the Rennaisance period as well as being one of the very first humanists.
Garcilaso was a Spanish solider and was the most influential poet to introduce aspects of the Italian Rennaisance to Spain.
Roman poet from the first-century B.C., author of the Aeneid, greatly admired and imitated during the Spanish Golden Age.
Torquato Tasso (March 11, 1544-April 25, 1595) was a Italian poet of the 16th century best known for his poem Gerusalemme liberata.

person.persName: Félix Lope de Vega y Carpio
person.note: Loped de Vega was a Spanish playwrite and novelist, the author of Dama Boba. He is a key figure in the Spanish Golden-Age period for all of his literature works.

Soldier, poet, greatest prose writer of the Spanish Golden Age, author of Don Quixote. He and Lope had conflicting views on the nature of the comedia, and Cervantes's plays were much less successful in their time than Lope's.
Luís de Camões (XX-June 10, 1580) was one of Portugal's greatest poets. His work has been compared to those of Shakespeare, Dante and Virgil.
Don Guillén de Castro (November 4, 1569-July 28, 1631) was a Spainsh dramatist during the Golden age.Some of his works include his book, Ingratitud por amor and his play, Las mocedades del Cid.
Luis Vélez de Pastraña (August 1 1579–November 1, 1644) was a Spanish dramatist and novelist. He wrote over over 400 plays and about 10 books.
Juan de Arguijo (1567-1623) was a Spanish playwrite, novelist and musician during the Spanish Golden Age, at the time of the Baroque period. He was born in Sevilla to a wealthy family.

Liñán (December 19, 1629-June 28, 1708) was a Roman Catholic who was the Archbishop and Viceroy of Lima, Peru during his lifetime. He studied at the University of Alcalá de Henares where we earned his doctorate degree.
Fernando de Herrera (1534-1597) was a 16th century Spanish poet who wrote a lot of letters during his life time. He was born in Sevilla.

Mateo Alemán (September 1547-1615) was a Spanish novelist and writer. He graduated from the University of Seville in 1564. In 1594 he was arrested on suspicion of malversation but was quickly released. In 1599, he published the first part of Guzmán de Alfarache
Sibila is a woman in ancient times who uttered the oracles and prophecies God.
Cumaean sibyl was a priestess who looked over an Apollonian oracle in a Greek colony located Naples, Italy.
The Eriteran sibyl was the prophetess of someone presiding over the Apollonian oracle at Erythrae. Erythrae is a town located in Ionia.
Gracias Graces is a sculpture of three women who are all dressed the same.

Musas, or muse in the english translation is something that artist uses for inspiration to create an art piece. This can be a person, idea, object or really anything that can influence the artist on what to create.
Febo Moniz (1515-1580) was a Portguese nobleman. He was the second son of Jerónimo Moniz and wife Violante da Silva.

Júpiter or Jupiter in the english translation is the God of sky and thunder in greek mythology and in roman mythology he is the king of all God's. He is usually associated with being the god of the sky.
Santo de Pajares is a term to describe someone whose holiness can't be trusted.
Pílades in greek mythology is the son of King Strophius of Phocis and is the brother of Artemus. He is mostly known for his strong friendship with his cousin Orestes.
In Greek mythology, Orestes was the son of Agamemnon and Clytemnestra. He is the center of a lot of Greek plays and myths with regards to his madness and purity.
In Greek mythology, Circe is the Goddess of Magic and the daugther of Helios, the god of the sun, and Perse, an Oceanid.
Ninfa or Nymph in the english translation, is a mythological spirit of nature who is portrayed as a beautiful maiden inhabiting rivers and woods.
Sirena or Sirens in the english translation are beautiful creatures who lure sailors to their islands with their beautiful songs and kill the sailors within Greek mythology.
In greek mythology a Fénix or phoenix in the english translation is a bird that never dies, it reincarnates. It is usually related to the idea of "rebirth".
Elena Osario was the muse, passion and love of Lope de Vega when he was writing this play.
A lovely shepherdess, main character of Cervantes's pastoral novel La Galatea.
Don Quijote is the main character of a novel written by Miguel de Cervantes in 1605. He is used in a lot of references in Spanish literature since then and even now.
Dios or God in the english translation is the center of the religion of Christianity. For this play in particular, it is relevant to the Catholic Monarchs who were ruling Spain during this time.
Adán or Adam in the english translation, is a reference to the story of Adam and Eve in the book of Genesis in the bible.
San Miguel or Saint Michael in the English translation, was a Saint in Spain during the time Lope de Vega was writing this play.
